page.title: 09Landscape
page.content: The Ballynahinch River is the centre of our community.It has several names and it's source is Lough Aughery near Dromara.The river runs mills in our area.One of the working mills is called Mary Brooke House.Now the river is used for fishing and a canoeing club also canoe on the river at Drumaghlis.On the 20th of May 1973 the Drumaghlis part of the river flooded very badly.The bridge was broken and the road was blocked for quite a while.The bridge was rebuilt and is now used a lot every day.The river itself is full of plants and there is quite a lot of wildlife.There are a lot of fish and frogs around and in the river.The river also has lots of reeds which sometimes grow quite high.
